summary: This is a brief email correspondence from September 5, 2020, submitting a government letter to Judge Freeman's chambers in support of a stay application in the case Doe v. Indyke, et al. It indicates ongoing legal proceedings related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Judge Freeman
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Freeman's chambers for consideration of a government letter supporting a stay application in the case Doe v. Indyke, et al.

events.title: Government Letter Submission
events.description: A letter from the Government in support of a stay application in the case Doe v. Indyke, et al. was submitted to Judge Freeman's chambers.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated September 5, 2020, submitting a government letter to Judge Freeman's chambers.
The letter supports a stay application in the case Doe v. Indyke, et al., indicating ongoing litigation related to Epstein.
The case referenced is Doe v. Indyke, et al., 20 Civ. 484 (DCF) (JGK), suggesting it is a civil case in the Southern District of New York.
